docblock.description: Uses native PHP sockets to communicate with CouchDB. This means zero new dependencies for your application.
docblock.long-description: This is also the original socket code that was used in Sag.

docblock.description: Provides a common interface for Sag to connect to CouchDB over HTTP, allowing for different drivers to be used thereby controling your project's dependencies.
Closes any sockets that are left open in the connection pool.
Native sockets does not support SSL.
Native sockets does not support SSL.

Uses the PHP cURL bindings for HTTP communication with CouchDB. This gives you more advanced features, like SSL supports, with the cost of an additional dependency that your shared hosting environment might now have.
Provides a common interface for Sag to connect to CouchDB over HTTP, allowing for different drivers to be used thereby controling your project's dependencies.
Used when we need to create a new adapter to follow a redirect because cURL can't.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Return value from url_parts() for the location header.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns $this if talking to the same server with the same protocol, otherwise creates a new instance.

docblock.description: Provides a common interface for Sag to connect to CouchDB over HTTP, allowing for different drivers to be used thereby controling your project's dependencies.
Used by the concrete HTTP adapters, this abstracts out the generic task of turning strings from the net into response objects.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The body of the HTTP packet.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The request's HTTP method ("HEAD", etc.).

tag.name: returns
tag.description: stdClass The response object.

docblock.description: A utility function for the concrete adapters to turn the HTTP Cookie header's value into an object (map).

tag.name: param
tag.description: The HTTP Cookie header value (not including the "Cookie: " key.

tag.name: returns
tag.description: stdClass An object mapping cookie name to cookie value.

docblock.description: Processes the packet, returning the server's response.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The HTTP method for the request (ex., "HEAD").

tag.name: param
tag.description: The URL to hit, not including the host info (ex., "/_all_docs").

tag.name: param
tag.description: A serialized version of any data that needs to be sent in the packet's body.

tag.name: param
tag.description: An associative array of headers where the keys are the header names.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Uses the provided host for this packet only - does not change the adapter's global host setting.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Uses the provided port for this packet only - does not change the adapter's global port setting.

tag.name: returns
tag.description: stdClass The response object created by makeResponse().

docblock.description: Whether to use HTTPS or not.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Whether to use HTTPS or not.

docblock.description: Sets the location of the CA file.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The absolute path to the CA file, or null to unset.

docblock.description: Returns whether Sag is using SSL.

tag.name: returns
tag.description: bool Returns true if the adapter is using SSL, else false.

docblock.description: Sets how long Sag should wait to establish a connection to CouchDB.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The number of seconds.

docblock.description: Set how long we should wait for an HTTP request to be executed.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The number of seconds.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The number of microseconds.

docblock.description: Returns an associative array of the currently set timeout values.

tag.name: return
tag.description: An associative array with the keys 'open', 'rwSeconds', and 'rwMicroseconds'.

docblock.description: A utility function that sets the different timeout values based on an associative array.

tag.name: param
tag.description: An associative array with the keys 'open', 'rwSeconds', and 'rwMicroseconds'.

docblock.description: Provides utilities to work with and manage CouchDB users, which wraps the Sag class.

tag.name: param
tag.description: An instantiated copy of Sag that you want this class to use. If you don't specify a database (empty($sag->currentDatabase())) then it will be set to '_users'.

docblock.description: Creates a user and returns the server's response. If no name is provided, then the id is duplicated into that position.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The user's ID without the 'org.couchdb.user:' prefix.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The password, which will be salted and encrypted for you.

tag.name: param
tag.description: (OPTIONAL) The user's name. If not provided, then it will be the same as the provided $id.

tag.name: param
tag.description: (OPTIONAL) An array of roles (strings) for the user.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The server's response, as you would expect from Sag's put() function.

docblock.description: Returns the user document from the database (just the response body, not HTTP info).

tag.name: param
tag.description: The user's _id.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Specify whether the $id you are providing has 'org.couchdb.user:' prepended to it. If it doesn't (set to false, which is the default) then the string will be prepended for you.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The user document: just the body property from Sag->get()'s return value.

docblock.description: Takes a user document and new password, generates a salt, and updates the password for that user document. You can optionally have the function send the updated document to the server as well.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The user document. Expected to look like what SagUserUtils->getUser() returns.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The new password for the user.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Whether to PUT the document to the server after updating it. Defaults to false.

tag.name: return
tag.description: If you set $upload to false, then just the updated document is returned. If you set $upload to true, then the result of Sag->put() is returned, so you get the updated document and HTTP information.

docblock.description: Generates a salt that will be used when setting users' passwords. By default it requests a uuid from the CouchDB server you specified.

tag.name: return
tag.description: A randomly generated string of characters that will be used to salt users' passwords.

parse_markers.error: No summary was found for this file

docblock.description: All the caching systems that Sag can leverage must extend this. The cache values should always be the object that Sag::procPacket() would return.
docblock.long-description:
The default cache size is 1MB (one million bytes).
Cache values are objects (stdClass for PHP storage, or JSON for external storage).

docblock.description: Returns the cached object or null if nothing is cached.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The URL of the request we're caching.

docblock.description: Caches the item returned at the provided key, replacing any pre-existing cached item. If the cache's size will be exceeded by caching the new item, then it will remove items from the cache until there is sufficient room.
docblock.long-description:
Returns false if the item cannot be added to the cache for any reason: exceeds the cache size, invalid type, or relevant HTTP headers.
Returns true if we were able to add the item, and there was no previously cached item.
Returns the previously cached item if there was one and we were able to add the new item to the cache.
Sag will refuse to cache the object by throwing a SagException if adding the file to the cache would exceed 95% of the disk or partition's free space.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The URL of the request we're caching.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The response we're caching.

docblock.description: Removes the item from the cache and returns it (null if nothing was cached).

tag.name: param
tag.description: The URL of the response we're removing from the cache.

docblock.description: Clears the whole cache without applying any logic.
docblock.long-description: Returns true if the entire cache was cleared, otherwise false if only part or none of it was cleared.

docblock.description: Sets the max size of the cache in bytes.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The size of the cache in bytes (>0).

docblock.description: Returns the max size of the cache, irrespective of what is or isn't in the cache.
Returns the total size of the items in the cache in bytes. Not reliable if you're using SagMemoryCache.
Generates the hash of the provided URL that will be used as the cache key.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The URL to hash.

docblock.description: Returns whether or not the item may be cached. It has to be a stdClass that Sag would return, with a valid E-Tag, and no cache headers that tell us to not cache.

tag.name: param
tag.description: item that we're trying to cache - it should be a response as a stdClass.

Argument $item is missing from the Docblock of mayCache()

docblock.description: This exception is thrown when CouchDB reports an error, such as sending malformed JSON, and not Sag.
docblock.long-description: The exception's code ($e->getCode()) is the HTTP status code. For example, if the requested document isn't found, then the code would be set to "404" (string).

parse_markers.error: No summary was found for this file
Argument $msg is missing from the Docblock of __construct()
Argument $code is missing from the Docblock of __construct()

docblock.description: The Sag class provides the core functionality for talking to CouchDB.

tag.name: var
tag.description: Used by login() to use HTTP Basic Authentication.

tag.name: var
tag.description: Used by login() to use HTTP Cookie Authentication.

tag.name: var
tag.description: Used to identify SagNativeHTTPAdapter by setHTTPAdapter() and company.

tag.name: var
tag.description: Used to identify SagCURLHTTPAdapter by setHTTPAdapter() and company.

tag.name: param
tag.description: (OPTIONAL) The host's IP or address of the Couch we're connecting to. Defaults to '127.0.0.1'.

tag.name: param
tag.description: (OPTIONAL) The host's port that Couch is listening on. Defaults to '5984'.

docblock.description: Set which HTTP library you want to use for communicating with CouchDB.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The type of adapter you want to use. Should be one of the Sag::$HTTP_* variables.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns $this.

docblock.description: Returns the current HTTP adapter being used.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Will be equal to Sag::$HTTP_NATIVE_SOCKETS or Sag::$HTTP_CURL.

docblock.description: Updates the login credentials in Sag that will be used for all further communications. Pass null to both $user and $pass to turn off authentication, as Sag does support blank usernames and passwords - only one of them has to be set for packets to be sent with authentication.
docblock.long-description: Cookie authentication will cause a call to the server to establish the session, and will throw an exception if the credentials weren't valid.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The username you want to login with. (null for none)

tag.name: param
tag.description: The password you want to login with. (null for none)

tag.name: param
tag.description: The type of login system being used. Defaults to Sag::$AUTH_BASIC.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns true if the input was valid. If using $AUTH_COOKIE, then the autoSession value will be returned. Throws on failure.

docblock.description: Get current session information on the server with /_session.
Sets whether Sag will decode CouchDB's JSON responses with json_decode() or to simply return the JSON as a string. Defaults to true.

tag.name: param
tag.description: True to decode, false to not decode.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns $this.

docblock.description: Performs an HTTP GET operation for the supplied URL. The database name you provided is automatically prepended to the URL, so you only need to give the portion of the URL that comes after the database name.
docblock.long-description: You are responsible for URL encoding your own parameters.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The URL, with or without the leading slash.

docblock.description: Performs an HTTP HEAD operation for the supplied document. This operation does not try to read from a provided cache, and does not cache its results.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The URL, with or without the leading slash.

docblock.description: DELETE's the specified document.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The document's _id.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The document's _rev.

docblock.description: PUT's the data to the document.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The document's _id.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The document, which should have _id and _rev properties. Can be an object, array, or string.

docblock.description: POST's the provided document. When using a SagCache, the created document and response are not cached.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The document that you want created. Can be an object, array, or string.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Can be the path to a view or /all_docs. The database will be prepended to the value.

docblock.description: Bulk pushes documents to the database.
docblock.long-description: This function does not leverage the caching mechanism you specify with setCache().

tag.name: param
tag.description: An array of the documents you want to be pushed; they can be JSON strings, objects, or arrays.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Whether to treat the transactions as "all or nothing" or not. Defaults to false.

docblock.description: COPY's the document.
docblock.long-description: If you are using a SagCache and are copying to an existing destination, then the result will be cached (ie., what's copied to the /$destID URL).

tag.name: param
tag.description: The _id of the document you're copying.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The _id of the document you're copying to.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The _rev of the document you're copying to. Defaults to null.

docblock.description: Sets which database Sag is going to send all of its database related communications to (ex., dealing with documents).
docblock.long-description: When specifying that the database should be created if it doesn't already exists, this will cause an HTTP GET to be sent to /dbName and createDatabase($db) if a 404 response is returned. So, only turn it on if it makes sense for your application, because it could cause needless HTTP GET calls.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The database's name, as you'd put in the URL. This string will be URL encoded using PHP's urlencode().

tag.name: param
tag.description: Whether to try and create the specified database if it doesn't exist yet (checks every time this is called).

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns $this. Throws on failure.

docblock.description: Gets all the documents in the database with _all_docs. Its results will not be cached by SagCache.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Whether to include the documents or not. Defaults to false.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Limits the number of documents to return. Must be >= 0, or null for no limit. Defaults to null (no limit).

tag.name: param
tag.description: The startkey variable (valid JSON). Defaults to null.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The endkey variable (valid JSON). Defaults to null.

tag.name: param
tag.description: An array of keys (strings) of the specific documents you're trying to get.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Whether to sort the results in descending order or not.

docblock.description: Gets all the databases on the server with _all_dbs.
Uses CouchDB to generate IDs.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The number of IDs to generate (>= 0). Defaults to 10.

docblock.description: Creates a database with the specified name.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the database you want to create.

docblock.description: Deletes the specified database.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The database's name.

docblock.description: Starts a replication job between two databases, independently of which database you set with Sag.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the database that you are replicating from.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the database that you are replicating to.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Whether to make this a continuous replication job or not. Defaults to false.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Specifies create_target, which will create the target database if it does not already exist. (optional)

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the filter function to use. (optional)

tag.name: param
tag.description: An object or associative array of parameters to be passed to the filter function via query_params. Only used if $filter is set.

docblock.description: Starts a compaction job on the database you selected, or optionally one of its views.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The database's view that you want to compact, instead of the whole database.

docblock.description: Create or update attachments on documents by passing in a serialized version of your attachment (a string).

tag.name: param
tag.description: The attachment's name.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The attachment's data, in string representation. Ie., you need to serialize your attachment.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The proper Content-Type for your attachment.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The _id of the document that the attachment belongs to.

tag.name: param
tag.description: optional The _rev of the document that the attachment belongs to. Leave blank if you are creating a new document.

docblock.description: Sets how long Sag should wait to establish a connection to CouchDB.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns $this.

docblock.description: How long Sag should wait to execute a request with CouchDB. If not set, then either default_socket_timeout from your php.ini or cURL's defaults are used depending on which adapter you're using.
docblock.long-description: Use setOpenTimeout() to set the timeout on opening the socket.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The seconds part of the timeout.

tag.name: param
tag.description: optional The microseconds part of the timeout.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns $this.

docblock.description: Returns the cache object that's currently being used.
Returns the name of the database Sag is currently working with, or null if setDatabase() hasn't been called yet.
Retrieves the run time metrics from CouchDB that lives at /_stats.
Set whether or not to include ?stale=ok by default when running GET and HEAD requests.
docblock.long-description: When set to true, a very slight overhead in the get() and head() functions will occur, as they will parse out the parameters from the URL you provide and ensure that no other value is being passed to the stale variable.

tag.name: param
tag.description: True will make stale=ok be sent by default.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns $this.

docblock.description: Sets a global cookie that will overwrite any other internal cookie values that Sag tries to set. For example, if you set AuthSession and call login(), then the AuthSession value you specify will overwrite the value retrieved from the server, so don't set AuthSession while using login().
docblock.long-description: Setting the value to null will make Sag no longer send the cookie.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The cookie's key.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The cookie's value.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns $this.

docblock.description: Returns the global cookie as set in setCookie().

tag.name: return
tag.description: The cookie's value or null if not set.

docblock.description: Set whether to use SSL or not.
docblock.long-description: By default the host's certificate will not be verified: you must provide a certifivate to setSSLCert() to enable verification.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Set to true to use SSL, false to not.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns $this.

docblock.description: Returns whether Sag is using SSL or not.

tag.name: return
tag.description: true means Sag is using SSL, false means Sag is not.

docblock.description: Provide a path to a file that contains one or more certificates to verify the CouchDB host with when using SSL. Only applies if you set useSSL(true).

tag.name: param
tag.description: File path to the certificate file. Pass null to unset the path.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns $this.

docblock.description: Takes a URL and k/v combo for a URL parameter, break the query string out of the URL, and sets the parameter to the k/v pair you pass in. This will overwrite a paramter's value if it already exists in the URL, or simply create it if it doesn't already.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The URL to run against.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The name of the parameter to set in the URL.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The value of the parameter to set in the URL.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The modified URL.

docblock.description: Cache to the local hard disk. Uses /tmp by default, but you can specify another location.
docblock.long-description:
Cache keys are used for file names and the contents are JSON. System file sizes are used to calculate the cache's current size.
Every operation goes to the disk, so this cache will not be ideal for high I/O operations.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The file system path to the directory that should be used to store the cache files. The local system's temp directory is used by default.

docblock.description: Generates the full filename/path that would be used for a given URL's cache object.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The URL for the cached item.

docblock.description: Stores cached items in PHP's memory as serialized JSON, which was benchmarked as being faster than serliaze() and clone.
docblock.long-description: Cache sizing is not supported with this caching mechanism. This is because PHP is not accurate at reporting memory allocation and it does not make sense to increase latency to implement a broken feature.
